title: Travel leaders say Trump's budget would kill program that promotes trips to the U.S.
text: "With all that's going on in the world, unilaterally disarming the marketing of the U.S. as a travel destination would be to surrender market share at the worst possible time," said Roger Dow, chief executive of the U.S. Travel Assn., a trade group.
summary: "With all that's going on in the world, unilaterally disarming the marketing of the U.S. as a travel destination would be to surrender market share at the worst possible time," said Roger Dow, chief executive of the U.S. Travel Assn., a trade group.
